summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing how to handle document requests from Jeffrey Epstein's defense lawyers following his death. The requests are related to his death and the chain shows internal coordination on assigning an AUSA as a point of contact and considering whether to refer the matter to the Civil Division.

persons.name: Michael C. Miller
persons.role: Defense Attorney (Partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP)
persons.context: He is the sender of the initial correspondence attaching document requests from Epstein's defense team to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI regarding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on Michael Miller's initial email, indicating he is part of Epstein's defense legal team.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on Michael Miller's initial email, indicating he is part of Epstein's defense legal team.

persons.context: Listed as a recipient on Michael Miller's initial email, indicating he is part of Epstein's defense legal team.

persons.name: Jason Meade
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on Michael Miller's initial email, indicating he is part of Epstein's defense legal team.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant in case 19-CRIM-00490. The document requests from his lawyers are related to his death.

connections.description: Miller is sending document requests on behalf of Epstein's defense team, indicating he is acting as legal counsel for Epstein's estate or interests posthumously.
Weingarten is cc'd on the legal correspondence regarding document requests for Epstein's case, indicating his role on the defense team.

events.title: Defense Team Submits Document Requests
events.description: Epstein's defense lawyers, led by Michael C. Miller, send formal document requests to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI regarding Epstein's death, seeking information.

events.title: Internal SDNY Coordination on Epstein Death Requests
events.description: SDNY staff internally discuss how to handle posthumous document requests from Epstein's defense team, considering assignment of an AUSA and potential referral to the Civil Division.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense team was actively seeking documents related to his death from the SDNY, MCC, and FBI as of August 20, 2019.
The SDNY was internally uncertain about the proper procedure for handling these posthumous requests, debating whether to assign an AUSA or refer them to the Civil Division.
The email chain reveals the defense legal team included Michael C. Miller, Reid Weingarten, Martin G. Weinberg, Michael Scavelli, and Jason Meade.
The correspondence indicates there was 'no proceeding' pending related to Epstein's death at the time, but the defense was still making formal requests.
The document shows internal government coordination and procedural questions following a high-profile defendant's death while in custody.
